subject: Modification about smack label of db file belong to process.
commitMessage:
Modification about smack label of db file belong to process.

[Problem] 
Most db files have 'floor' label.  Because these are created during image creation time.
Therefore no process can write the dbs (since 'floor' label allows only read and execute)

[Solution] 
Modify smack label of the db files based on condition below referring three domain model
Condition1. Assign domain of process which creates db files
Condition2. Assign domain of process accesses db files.

Change-Id: I5b170aeb15543df723d4bc736c4dcb872ff4d7fd
Signed-off-by: jooseong.lee <jooseong.lee@samsung.com>

owner.name: Baptiste (DO NOT USE) DURAND (DO NOT USE)

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       armv7hl        unresolvable   

 standard       x86_64         succeeded      

 standard       i586           succeeded

reviewer.name: Baptiste (DO NOT USE) DURAND (DO NOT USE)

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Verified

This patch fix the build of initdb.

See below the build log:
[   12s] ###### API Generator #####
[   12s] gcc -g -Wall     schema-header-gen.c   -o schema-header-gen
[   12s] rm -rf schema-header-gen.o schema-header-gen
[   12s] gcc -g -Wall  `pkg-config --cflags db-util`   `pkg-config --libs db-util`  ../initdb.c   -o ../initdb
[   12s] /tmp/ccd84zd3.o: In function `remake_db_file':
[   12s] /home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/calendar-service-0.1.15/schema/db-gen/../initdb.c:57: undefined reference to `db_util_open'
[   12s] /home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/calendar-service-0.1.15/schema/db-gen/../initdb.c:65: undefined reference to `sqlite3_exec'
[   12s] /home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/calendar-service-0.1.15/schema/db-gen/../initdb.c:68: undefined reference to `sqlite3_free'
[   12s] /home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/calendar-service-0.1.15/schema/db-gen/../initdb.c:71: undefined reference to `db_util_close'
 

The patch fixes Makefile.

Note that  
pkg-config --libs db-util return only -lSLP-db-util -lsqlite3 -ldlog -lpthread -lglib-2.0 -licui18n -licuuc -licudata 
even if in pc file of db-util we have :
Libs: -L${libdir} -lSLP-db-util

to have -L/usr/lib64 in LDFlags, I use :
pkg-config --variable=libdir db-util
to get libdir value of pc file.

Built successfully against Public repository.
http://download.tizen.org/snapshots/common/latest/repos/tizen/x86_64/packages/

This patch fix the build of initdb binary.
In consequences, db file are correcly generated.
Patch Set 1: Verified
Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, approved
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Revert "Fix install section of spec"

owner.name: Baptiste (DO NOT USE) DURAND (DO NOT USE)

commitMessage:
Revert "Fix install section of spec"

This reverts commit e1c91387de0fe976d4bf52f242bcda5caa9dd925.

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       armv7hl        unresolvable   

 standard       x86_64         failed         

 standard       i586           failed

reviewer.name: Baptiste (DO NOT USE) DURAND (DO NOT USE)

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Verified

Revert commit e1c91387de0fe976d4bf52f242bcda5caa9dd925. because this patch doesn't fix the root cause of build faillure.

/opt/usr/dbspace/.calendar-svc.db and /opt/usr/dbspace/.calendar-svc.db-journal are database file not directories

reviewer.name: Baptiste (DO NOT USE) DURAND (DO NOT USE)

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

During build, a binary called initdb is built and executed.
It permits to generate the missing db file.
Here the root cause is a initdb build faillure
Patch Set 1: Verified
Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, approved
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.
